III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
Section • (1) An agency shall provide supervision for a youth in
Description independent living consistent with the youth's need for
supervision, as required by R 400.12504(2)(e).
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was inappropriately touched by two other youths and
Youth A does not feel safe.
Investigation Allegation was made that on an unknown date Youth C and Youth
D groped Youth A by touching Youth A's chest and buttocks.
Allegation was also made that on 06/12/2025 Youth B attacked
Youth A in the bathroom and Youth A had to pepper spray Youth
B.
Interviews:
DCWL Consultant 2 interviewed Youth A in person on
06/20/2025. Youth A reported Youth A's worker would visit Youth
A 2-3 times each month and additional times if requested by
Youth A. Youth A alleged Youth C and Youth D groped Youth A
more than 5 times, but Youth A could not report any specific dates
of the alleged occurrences. Youth A stated Youth A did not report
any of these alleged incidents to any staff at the residence, but
Staff 1 was in the area. Youth A did not report any information
associated with the complaint regarding Youth B attacking Youth
A or Youth A pepper-spraying Youth B.
I interviewed Foster Care Monitor by phone on 08/11/2025.
Foster Care Monitor described Youth A as typically exaggerating
incidents and being selective in including all the circumstances
associated with any reported incidents. Foster Care Monitor
described as one example where Youth A reported being hit by
another youth, but Youth A didn't include the fact that Youth A hit
the other youth first. Foster Care Monitor stated he did not have
any concerns related to the services being provided by the agency
in this program. Foster Care Monitor stated Foster Care Worker
works well with Foster Care Monitor.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 08/19/2025.
Foster Care Worker indicated the allegations made by Youth A
were never reported to staff by Youth A. Foster Care Worker
denied any incidents where Youth A allegedly pepper sprayed
2

Youth B on 06/12/2025. Foster Care Worker stated Youth A
pepper sprayed a staff member on 06/12/2025 when Youth A was
mad at the staff because the staff member could not give Youth A
the pass code for the Wi-Fi. Foster Care Worker stated it was this
assault on staff and Youth A's subsequent truancy that led to
Youth A's discharge from the program.
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 08/19/2025 and
Complainant did not have any additional information than what
was reported in the initial complaint.
I interviewed Chief Administrator and Foster Care Supervisor
by phone on 08/19/2025. They assisted in identifying the other
youth reported in the allegation and facilitated the phone
interviews with Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D.
I interviewed Youth B by phone on 08/19/2025. Youth B denied
assaulting Youth A in the bathroom on 06/12/2025. Youth B
described the bathrooms at the residence as having a list of
people on the door, but the list indicates who is responsible for
cleaning the bathroom and not who can use the bathroom. Youth
B stated anyone can use a given bathroom at any time as needed.
Youth B denied being pepper sprayed by Youth A on 06/12/2025.
I interviewed Youth C and Youth D separately by phone on
08/19/2025. Both youth denied groping the chest and buttocks of
Youth A. Both youth stated the residents will wrestle with each
other as a form of play at times, but both youth denied ever
groping Youth A.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 2 by phone on 08/19/2025.
Foster Care Worker 2 denied any knowledge of the allegations
made by Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 1 by phone on 08/20/2025. Staff 1 denied
observing any residents assaulting or groping Youth A. Staff 1
described Youth A as having OCD or some other condition where
Youth A does not want to be touched. Staff 1 stated Youth A is
very vocal, and Youth A would have reported an incident if it
occurred.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the supervision policy of this program. The level of
support provided is consistent with the policy. Staff are present in
a support role for program participants.
3

I reviewed the Incident report and police report #2600010676
dated 6/12/25 associated with Youth A’s pepper spray incident
and discharge from this program. The police report confirms Youth
A pepper-sprayed Staff 2 because Youth A was frustrated she
couldn’t access the WiFi. Youth A stated nothing physical
occurred with Staff 2.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with Rule R 400.12504 (2)(e)
per staff and youth interviews completed. Staff 1 reported Youth
A had not made any complaints about youth groping her and Staff
1 did not witness anything like this occurring. In addition, the
police report received confirms Youth A pepper-sprayed Staff 2.
There is no information to support Youth B was pepper-sprayed
by anyone.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
